atelier.title: My Workshop
atelier.description:
Are you looking for a watch, a clock, or something else related to antiques? Or is your watch not working anymore? Come visit my workshop!
My workshop is open from Monday to Thursday between 2:30 PM and 5:00 PM.
I am located in Geneva, at Rue des Corps-Saints 10, 1201 Geneva.

exposition.title: Exhibition
exposition.description:
In 2018, I founded a small permanent exhibition called The Watchmaking Curiosities. I invite you to come and discover my world and share my passion for watchmaking.
The exhibition is located in a small village in the canton of Geneva. It is open to the public and you can visit it by appointment. Maximum 5 people per visit. Contact me here.

cabinotiers.title: What is a cabinotier?
cabinotiers.description:
The word 'cabinotier' is of Genevan origin. Combining meticulousness, technical precision, and innovation, the art of the cabinotiers of Saint-Gervais contributed to the distinction of Geneva. Since the 18th century, the word 'cabinotier' has encompassed professions related to watchmaking, such as case assemblers, guillocheurs, engravers, watchmakers, gilders, and enamelers. They worked from home or in tiny 'cabins' under the roofs of houses.
For more information on the history of the cabinotiers and my watchmaking collection, check out my catalog, or come visit my exhibition.

catalogue.title: My catalog: <g>Le Cabinotier</g>
catalogue.description:
Le Cabinotier is a small catalog that tells the story of the cabinotiers and presents a small part of my watchmaking collection. The catalog was created by Elodie Perring as part of her specialized maturity work.
To purchase the catalog, visit the workshop or contact me.
